remarks: Any bounded subset of an upper set of integers has a supremum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jul-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2015.)
statement:
uzsupss.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
uzsupss $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ A C_ Z /\ E. x e. ZZ A. y e. A y <_ x ) -> E. x e. Z ( A. y e. A -. x < y /\ A. y e. Z ( y < x -> E. z e. A y < z ) ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d M x y $.
$d Z x $.
